Award.AwardTitle: CIF21 DIBBs: Ubiquitous Access to Transient Data and Preliminary Results via the SeedMe Platform

Directorate.LongName: Direct For Computer & Info Scie & Enginr

Award.AbstractNarration:
Computational simulations have become an indispensible tool in a wide variety of science and engineering investigations. Quick and effective assessments of the resulting data are necessary for efficient use of researcher time and computation resources, but this process is complicated when a large collaborating team is geographically dispersed and/or some team members do not have direct access to the computation resource and output data. Current methods for sharing and assessing transient data and preliminary results are cumbersome and labor intensive; each research team must create their own scripts and ad hoc procedures to push data from system to system and user to user. Better tools and cyberinfrastructure are needed to support preliminary results sharing for collaborating computational science teams.

This project develops web-based building blocks and cyberinfrastructure to enable easy sharing and streaming of transient data and preliminary results from computing resources to a variety of platforms, from mobile devices to workstations, making it possible to quickly and conveniently view and assess results and provide an essential missing component in High Performance Computing and cloud computing infrastructure.

POR.DRECONTENT:
The project has developed SeedMeLab - a data management system to organize and share preliminary and transient results directly from HPC workloads and other applications on the Web. SeedMeLab converts a slow, manual, serial, error prone, repetitive, and redundant sharing and assessment process into a streamlined automatic and web accessible cyberinfrastructure. SeedMeLab is a set of modular building blocks that could be composed, customized and extended to support diverse research disciplines. The software suite allows easy creation of data cloud with rich data organization capability in familiar tree structure and enables researchers to describe, discuss and disseminate data products with access controls. Multiple instances of SeedMeLab cyberinfrastructure have been deployed for different research groups and Science Gateways that are fostering rapid assessment, iteration, communication, and dissemination of scientific data products. These capabilities have improved efficiency, improved data context retention, and accelerated the research pace for researchers. The project software provides a strong foundation to build platforms for Open Data that realize FAIR Data principles. 

The software modules (FolderShare, FolderShare REST, Chart Suite, Formatter Suite, and CILogon Auth) have been released under Open Source Software license and distributed via Drupal project's official software repository. The released software is steadily gaining adoption beyond the research community demonstrating societal impact with over 150 websites reporting active use as of Dec 2019. More information is available at the project website at http://seedmelab.org.


Last Modified: 12/31/2019
Modified by: Amit Chourasia

SeedMeLab converts a slow, manual, serial, error prone, repetitive, and redundant sharing and assessment process into a streamlined automatic and web accessible cyberinfrastructure. The software suite allows easy creation of data cloud with rich data organization capability in familiar tree structure and enables researchers to describe, discuss and disseminate data products with access controls. Multiple instances of SeedMeLab cyberinfrastructure have been deployed for different research groups and Science Gateways that are fostering rapid assessment, iteration, communication, and dissemination of scientific data products. These capabilities have improved efficiency, improved data context retention, and accelerated the research pace for researchers. The project software provides a strong foundation to build platforms for Open Data that realize FAIR Data principles. The software modules (FolderShare, FolderShare REST, Chart Suite, Formatter Suite, and CILogon Auth) have been released under Open Source Software license and distributed via Drupal project's official software repository.
